key_insight: Spatia preserves a persistent 3D scene point-cloud as spatial memory and continually updates it with visual SLAM, allowing iterative clip generation that maintains long-term spatial and temporal consistency.
problem_solved: Addresses the inability of current video generation models to keep coherent geometry and appearance over long sequences and across viewpoints due to dense, high-dimensional video signals.
method: Maintain a persistent 3D scene point-cloud as spatial memory to represent static scene geometry.
Iteratively generate short video clips conditioned on the spatial memory to produce temporally coherent segments.
Continuously update the spatial memory via visual SLAM, enabling a dynamic–static disentanglement and progressive scene refinement.
impact: Enables more stable, scene-consistent video synthesis, improving tasks like long-range view synthesis, scene editing, and simulation; useful for researchers and practitioners in video generative models, robotics, AR/VR, and simulation.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: persistent 3D point-cloud memory ↔ visual SLAM update loop ↔ iterative clip generator
Before/after sequence comparison: conventional generator (temporal drift) vs Spatia (consistent geometry across frames)
3D point-cloud overlay on generated frames to show memory-grounded rendering and updates
Timeline or flowchart illustrating dynamic–static disentanglement and incremental memory updates
paper_title: Spatia: Video Generation with Updatable Spatial Memory
paper_authors: Jinjing Zhao, Fangyun Wei, Zhening Liu, Hongyang Zhang, Chang Xu
